node.title: Team New Zealand attempt land speed record
node.description: Team New Zealand is helping a champion sailor achieve a childhood dream with a world record attempt. Video

node.title: Family of shark attack victim Simon Nellist say he was a 'gentle' and 'wonderful' man
node.description: The family of a diving instructor who was fatally attacked by a shark in Sydney last week say he was a "gentle, kind and wonderful human being".

node.title: Transcript: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg that aired Sunday, February 20, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Transcript: Secretary of State Antony Blinken on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Secretary of State Antony Blinken that aired Sunday, February 20, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Transcript: Russian Ambassador Anatoly Antonov on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Russian Ambassador to the U.S. Anatoly Antonov airing Sunday, February 20, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: U.S. has intel that Russian commanders have orders to proceed with invasion
node.description: The U.S. has intelligence that Russian commanders have received orders to proceed with an invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: How the murders of two Black sons ignited social justice movements
node.description: New York Times columnist Charles Blow reflects on how the 2012 killing of 17-year-old Trayvon Martin – like the 1955 lynching of 14-year-old Emmett Till – sparked protest movements led by mothers with tears on their cheeks but steel in their spines.

node.title: Black Americans approve of Biden, but not on inflation - CBS News poll
node.description: Biden's approval on inflation is lower than other approvals; ratings are not as high compared to start of his term.

node.title: Beijing's Olympics come to a close, ending safe but odd global moment
node.description: The terrarium of a Winter Games that has been Beijing 2022​ came to its end Sunday.

node.title: Franklin Pierce: America's handsomest president?
node.description: No survey of worst presidents would be complete without our 14th, whose amiability and good looks were offset by his support for the 1854 Kansas-Nebraska Act, which led to clashes between pro- and anti-slavery forces, presaging the Civil War.

node.title: Sarah Jessica Parker and Matthew Broderick: The show does go on
node.description: Two years ago the husband-and-wife actors were set to star in a Broadway revival of Neil Simon's "Plaza Suite" when COVID-19 shut down theaters. Now, the show is finally set to open, and the stars talk about the unprecedented hiatus.

node.title: Byron Allen on the road to media mastery
node.description: Four years ago the comedian and broadcasting mogul bought the Weather Channel for $310 million in cash. Now, his bid to buy the Denver Broncos, if successful, would make him the NFL's first Black majority owner.

node.title: The revelatory art of Joseph Yoakum
node.description: The self-taught artist didn't start creating, using ballpoint pens, colored pencils and pastels, until he was in his 70s. A show currently at New York's Museum of Modern Art highlights his fanciful landscapes.

node.title: Tears for Fears returns with "The Tipping Point"
node.description: English pop rockers Roland Orzabal and Curt Smith had numerous hits in the 1980s, but split in 1991 and didn't speak for nine years. Now reunited, their first album in 17 years is a collaboration that helped heal a personal tragedy.

node.title: How free speech is under attack in the U.S.
node.description: America was built on the premise of free speech, but today's news is filled with examples of limiting expression.

node.title: Russia extends troop drills near Ukraine as violence spikes
node.description: The presence of the Russian troops raised concern that they could be used to sweep down on the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv.

node.title: Queen Elizabeth II tests positive for COVID-19, experiencing mild symptoms
node.description: The palace said the 95-year-old British monarch will continue with light duties at Windsor Castle over the coming week.

node.title: Great Walk booking cancellations double
node.description: The Department of Conservation (DOC) received more than 7400 Great Walk booking cancellations between 1 December and 28 February.

node.title: Russia planning 'biggest war since 1945' - Boris Johnson
node.description: Evidence suggests Russia is planning "the biggest war in Europe since 1945", British Prime Minister Boris Johnson has said.

node.title: Canadian police use pepper spray, stun grenades in push to clear capital
node.description: Canadian police have used pepper spray and stun grenades in a final push to clear Ottawa of trucks and demonstrators protesting against pandemic restrictions.

node.title: Covid-19 update: Record 2522 new cases in NZ today
node.description: New Zealand's daily Covid-19 numbers have surpassed the 2000 mark for the first time, with a record 2522 new community cases reported today.

node.title: Ukranian rebels mobilise as fighting escalates
node.description: The breakaway territories go on a war footing amid fears Russia will use them as a pretext to invade.

node.title: Commerce Commission joins international crackdown on possible cartel behaviour
node.description: The Commerce Commission has joined competition regulators in four other countries in a crackdown on possible cartel behaviour in global supply chains.

node.title: Long-delayed Great Walk about to get over the Hump
node.description: Plans to upgrade the country's next Great Walk are out for tender, with hopes the project remains on track.

node.title: Appeal over medal ceremony postponement lost
node.description: American figure skaters lose appeal for a medal ceremony at the Beijing Winter Olympics after Russian teen's doping case forced a postponement.

node.title: Nelson residents warned of delays due to works on SH6
node.description: Resealing work along State Highway 6, south of Nelson will take part in stages next week to prevent the road from closing, but motorists are being warned to expect their journey to take longer than…

node.title: One dead after Owhiro Bay crash
node.description: Police say one person has died following a serious crash on Happy Valley Road in Owhiro Bay this morning.

node.title: One year later, family, friends continue search for missing mom
node.description: A California mother disappears without a trace – did her husband try to have a hex put on her so she wouldn't leave him?

node.title: 'We want our streets back' - Wellington mayor angry as protest continues
node.description: Wellington's mayor has said "we want our streets" back as the Covid-19 policy protest nears the end of its second week outside Parliament.

node.title: Australia reports 43 Covid-19 deaths before expanded border reopening
node.description: Australia recorded 43 coronavirus-related deaths on Saturday, as it readies to welcome international tourists on Monday for the first time in nearly two years.
